author: Retail Technology Review
title: JUST EAT whets appetite for growth with Dynamics AX from Columbus
text:
Send to friend 
JUST EAT plc, the online and mobile marketplace for takeaway food, has invested in the latest Microsoft Dynamics AX business solution as it aims to standardise its internal processes and position itself for even further international growth. 
The business, which has a presence in 15 countries worldwide, has invested in the fully integrated retail solution from international consultancy and Microsoft Gold Partner Columbus, after identifying Dynamics AX as a product well aligned with its cloud-first approach to technology. The solution will replace a legacy system, with modules catering for the core business functions of finance, sales, purchasing, expenses, internal project management and R&D cost management. Taking a staged approach, Columbus will implement Dynamics AX in the UK, before rolling out the solution worldwide. 
Martin Burden, Retail Practice Sales Director at Columbus, explained that the investment is set to drive even greater benefits to JUST EAT and its customers as AX becomes a critical business application that reduces costs for JUST EAT and helps boost the customer experience. 
"By using AX and RapidValue to standardise processes within JUST EAT, and centralise core operations across the business, the company will significantly improve operating processes. Furthermore, the ability to track information more effectively, better manage purchasing requests, and more effectively manage expenses, will all result in long term financial gains for JUST EAT, and this will subsequently help to improve its customer service levels." 
It was Columbus' experience as a consultancy with industry knowledge, which proved a key driver in JUST EAT's decision to invest in Microsoft Dynamics AX over alternative options. As part of the agreement, Columbus will utilise its unique RapidValue application and methodology to help JUST EAT review its business processes and requirements in order to adopt a solution as close to standard as possible. This business process led approach to ERP, together with the functionality of the AX product and Microsoft's cloud first approach, appealed greatly to Marcus Jennings, Group Financial Director at JUST EAT. 
Marcus Jennings commented: "We are really excited to be working together with Columbus and Microsoft to implement Dynamics AX across the business and start to utilise a solution that will enable us to grow and provide an even better customer experience. We know that we have a solution from Microsoft that is stable and is constantly being invested in and delivered, and a partner in Columbus with great experience in the retail environment, and decades of knowledge of ERP. Between us, we are confident that the project will be a huge success."
